definition: Xu Beihong (1895-1953), famous European trained painter and influential art teacher

sentences.english: Xu Beihong is good at painting horses.
sentences.chinese: 徐悲鸿画马画得特别好。

sentences.english: Xu Beihong's paintings of horses are exceptionally good.
sentences.chinese: 徐悲鸿的马的画像特别好。

sentences.english: Xu Beihong's drawings (paintings) of horses are exceptionally good.
sentences.chinese: 徐悲鸿画马画得非常好。

sentences.english: Xu Beihong’s drawings of horse are exceptionally good.
sentences.chinese: 徐悲鸿画马画得特别好。

sentences.english: His figure painting can best present his artistic idea of "being true to life".
sentences.chinese: 徐悲鸿的人物画最能体现其“惟妙惟肖”的艺术主张。

sentences.english: It is a reproduction of Xu Beihong's world-famous painting.
sentences.chinese: 那是徐悲鸿先生的世界名画的复制品。

sentences.english: Xubeihong is very good at painting horse.
sentences.chinese: 徐悲鸿画马画得特别好。

sentences.english: A student of oil painting in Renmin University of China.
sentences.chinese: 中国人民大学徐悲鸿艺术学院在校学生，油画专业。

definition: Chang Dai-chien or Zhang Daqian (1899-1983), one of the greatest Chinese artists of the 20th century
Huang Binhong (1865-1955), art historian and literati painter
Shi Tao (1642-1707), Chinese landscape painter and poet
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Giuseppe Castiglione (1688-1766) Jesuit who served as Qing court painter for 50 years
Mei Lanfang (1894-1961), famous master of Beijing opera, specialist in female roles
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Guo Moruo (1892-1978), writer, communist party intellectual and cultural apparatchik
